page.title: 09AN UPLAND FARMERS MORNING
page.content: A normal day in my life as an upland farmer near Hownam,in Scotland,with suckler cows and sheep,is from 6.45 a.m. to 8.p.m. I start the day with a cup of tea,and then it is outside to face the elements.I feed and milk the goats and give the orphen lambs their pellets.I let out the 2 sheep-dogs and go around the farm to check that the livestock have come to no harm over night.I find a ewe with mastitis which has to be caught, and given an injection of penicillen and a tube of penicillen must be inserted into her udder.Hopefully I have caught it in time,and she will recover.Then back to the house where my wife should have fed the goat-milk to the orphen lambs, and have my breakfast ready. It is a fine morning so my next job is to turn the hay,then if the weather holds, I can bale some in the afternoon.
